shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dawit “Psalter” (fols. 5r-215va) I-1) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David” (fols. 5r-171r) I-2) Mäḫalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 171r-187r) I-3) Mäḫalǝyä mäḫalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 187v-196v) I-4) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “The Gate of Light” (fols. 197va-202ra) I-5) Wǝddase Maryam “The Praise of Mary” (fols. 202rb-215va) I-6) Mäzmurä dǝngǝl “Psalter of the Virgin” (strophes distributed between sections of Texts I-1, I-2, I-3, fols. 5r-196v)
Additiones 1-8.

donors.donor: According to Additiones 3 and 4, the Ms. was donated by Ḫaylä Mikaʾel.

owners.owner: The name of the original owner has been erased from fol. 197va.

dcomments.dcomment: Second half of the 16th cent. (?) One bifolio in quire XVIII (fols. fols. 216 and 221) originates from a different (18th-cent.?) manuscript.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. has been resewn. The overback is damaged. Most leaves are stained with dirt and wax. Holes carefully amended: fols. 193, 196.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Remains of an overback made of light brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 6 tools were used: double line fillet, double circle, small x, corni form, double crescent, filled star).

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires; two close to the head and two close to the tail of the codex.

squires.squire:
A(4/fols. 1r-4v) – I(8/fols. 5r-12v) – II(8/fols. 13r-20v) – III(8/fols. 21r-28v) – IV(10/fols. 29r-38v) – V(10/fols. 39r-48v) – VI(10/fols. 49r-58v) – VII(10/fols. 59r-68v) – VIII(10/fols. 69r-78v) – IX(10/fols. 79r-88v) – X(10/fols. 89r-98v) – XI(10/fols. 99r-108v) – XII(10/fols. 109r-118v) – XIII(9/s.l.: 1/fols. 119r-127v) – XIV(10/fols. 128r-137v) – XV(10/fols. 138r-147v) – XVI(10/fols. 148r-157v) – XVII(10/fols. 158r-167v) – XVIII(10/fols. 168r-177v) – XIX(10/fols. 178r-187v) – XX(10/fols. 188r-197v) – XXI(10/fols. 198r-207v) – XXII(8/fols. 208r-215v) – XXIII(4+{2}/fols. 216r-221v)
Quire XXIII consists of two folios of irregular size, fols. 216 and 221 (bifolio originating from a different manuscript) and two more bifolios.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data for fol. 6r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-4, I-5: all data for fol. 198r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Numeral ፮ “six” looks like compressed numeral ፯ “seven”.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra (name of St. Mary in Texts I-4, I-5, I-6 and some other names); titles and numbers of the Pss. and Canticles; incipits and numbers of Songs; titles of Text I-6; title of Texts I-2, I-3 and I-4; title and incipit of the daily readings of Text I-5; a few single lines in Text I-4; refrains of Text I-5 (written out fully or abbreviated); elements of the punctuation signs and text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

abbreviations.abbreviation: Text I-4 Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain: ሠ፡/ሠረ፡/ሠረቀ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 202rb-203vb) እስ፡/እስመ፡ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ (fols. 204ra-206rb) ኵ፡/ኵሉ፡ for ኵሉ፡ ትውልድ፡ ያስተበፅዑኪ፡ ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ (fols. 206va-208va) ናዓ፡/ናዓብ: for ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። እስመ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ይኵን፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵልነ (fols. 209ra-210va) ተፈ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ (fols. 213rb-214ra) ወ፡/ወበ፡/ወበእንተዝ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 214va-215va)

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Traditional titles of the Pss. have probably been added later, in a secondary hand: e.g., fols. 5v, 40v, 45v, 48r.

additional.cont: Fols. 1ra-rb, 197ra-rb: Calendar regulations.
additional.det: The note is much later than the main text. Some parts of it are hardly legible.

additional.cont: Fols. 1va-4vb, 215vb, 217ra-219rb: Ṣäwatəwä fəṭrät “Kinds of creation” (unidentified).
additional.det: A short text in Old Amharic concerning the history of the creation.

additional.cont: Fol. 196v: Donation note.
additional.add: Fol. 196v: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ዘኃይለ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ዘወሀቦ፡ ለዮሐንስ፡ መጥምቅ፡ ዘኰኰሎ፡ ዘደብረ፡ ቤቴል፡ ዘሠረቆ፡ ወዘፈሐቆ፡ በ፡ ጴ፡ ወ፡ ው።
additional.tran: Fol. 196v: This is a book of Ḫaylä Mikaˀel who has donated it to (the church of) John the Baptist of Kwäkwälo, of Däbrä Betel. He who steals it or erases (its text shall be excommunicated by the authority of Peter and Paul).
additional.det: The note is crudely written over an erased text, in the same hand as Additio 4. It states that the Ms. was donated by Ḫaylä Mikaʾel to the church of John the Baptist of Kwäkwälo, of Däbrä Betel.

additional.cont: Fol. 197rb: Donation note.
additional.tran:
Fol. 197rb: This is a Psalter of Ḫaylä Mikaˀel Gäbrä Kidan, Gäbrä Maryam, Wäldä Mikaˀel, ˀAkalä Giyorgis.
This is a Psalter of Ḫaylä Mikaˀel who has donated it to (the church of) John the Baptist, so that it might be for him the salvation of body and soul. He who steals it or erases (its text) shall be excommunicated by the authority of Peter and Paul.
additional.det: The note is crudely written over an erased text, in the same hand as Additio 3.

additional.cont: Fols. 218v, 219r, 219v, 220r, 220v: Extensive notes concerning economic activities (?).
additional.det: The notes are crudely written in Amharic.

additional.cont: Fol. 219rb, ls.5-14: Excerpt from a theological treatise (?).
additional.det: Crudely written in a secondary hand.

additional.cont: Fol. 219va, l.1-vb, l.21:  ˀAsmat-prayer.
additional.det: Crudely written in a secondary hand.

additional.cont: Fol. 220r, ls.1-11: Two short notes on medicine.
additional.det: The note is written in Amharic, in the same hand as Additio 8.

extras.extra: - The title of the work ዳዊት፡ መዝሙረ፡ ዳዊት፡ is written on a piece of paper glued onto the back cover. - The Pss. are divided into groups of ten separated by a simple band in the shape of a snake, in red with a black outline. The bands have been added later, possibly by the main hand. From fol. 58v onwards, they are of recent origin, in crayon. The division corresponds to the insertion of coloured threads. - The scribe reduced the size of his handwriting to accommodate the whole line or the end of the line: fols. 55r, 136r, 154r, 164v. - Part of the line is taken up: fols. 25v, 30v, 32v, 38v, 66v, 91v, 180v. - Part of the line is taken down: fols. 38v, 45v, 96r, 151v. - Ethiopic numeral ፲ is written beside a verse of a Ps. on fols. 5r-163r. - Omitted letters, words, lines or passages written interlineally, in the main hand and in a secondary hand: e.g., fols. 16v, 33r, 34r, 36r, 43r, 53v, 55v, 60r, 75r, 77r, 91v, 95r, 105r, 109v, 111r, 112r, 119rv, 123r, 128r, 144r, 153v, 159r, 164r, 172r, 177r, 183v, 200rb, 200va. - Corrections written over erasures, in the main hand: e.g., fols. 24r, 26r, 31r, 36r, 50r, 67r, 80v, 82v, 129r, 189r. - Corrections written over erasures, in a secondary hand: e.g., fols. 20r, 51v. - Erasures marked with thin lines: e.g., fols. 6v, 13v, 22r, 27v, 43r, 82v, 98v, 110r, 114r. - Erasures: e.g., fols. 7r, 63v, 80v, 99r, 102v, 104r, 126r, 190v. - Directives as to how to use the Psalms on some fols.: 176r, 177v, 178r, 179v, 182r, 184v, - A folio originating from another, possibly older ms., has been added as a guard leaf into quire XXIII. It contains a fragment of the Miracles of Jesus, concerning the Adoration of the Magi: fols. 216r-v, 221r-v. - Scribbles, writing exercises, doodles: fols. 5r, 14r, 17r, 48r, 112v, 165v, 196v, 197v, 198r, 208v, 209r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Indications concerning the special occasion when a Ps. or a Canticle could be read: fols. 59v, 176r, 177v, 178r, 179v, 182r, 185v. - Coloured threads are inserted in the right upper corner of fols. 14, 24, 34, 48, 58, 67, 93, 105, 113, 129, 153, 162, 171, 187.
